definition: to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
to buy or sell on credit/distant/long (time)/to forgive

sentences.english: In addition, at present US firms are allowed to claim a credit against their American taxes for foreign taxes paid.
sentences.chinese: 另外，目前美国企业可以为应缴的境外税金申请赊欠。

sentences.english: You know well that people refuse me.
sentences.chinese: 您知道人家都不肯赊欠了。

sentences.english: In the market, they give you credit, " said Desjardin."
sentences.chinese: 在市场上，他们给你赊欠。

sentences.english: No credit is given at this shop.
Some importers were frightened by the economic depression and refused to extend credit to customer.
sentences.chinese: 有些进口商慑于经济萧条，拒绝客户赊欠。

definition: to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
to buy on credit/to delay payment
to buy or sell on credit/distant/long (time)/to forgive
to write an IOU or promissory note
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to get an advance on one's pay
room charge in a hotel/accommodation expenses
to borrow money/to take a loan
to demand payment/to collect overdue payment
